relation: You can join many of the school clubs, or even hang out in the Nordic lounge.
The cafeteria is very expensive and the food is not very good, It's best to go off campus for food.
The class atmosphere can be very challenging at times because of the large amount os students that some teachers have in a class. But there are some very great professors.
Try to enroll into classes as early as possible, It can be impossible to get into any classes if you wait too long.

Long beach city is a great school, but there are far too many students enrolled. It is very hard to get the required and transferable classes, also the class sizes are horribly big with bad teacher to student ratios.
pageTitle: Long Beach City College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {466713=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 189072=Make sure that if you are receiving Financial Aid that you check in with the financial aid office before school starts, like in July and make sure that all your information is turned in and completed., 329583=Major construction will begin on campus from July 2013 thru July 2014. The construction may cause a bit of a mess in terms of parking but the new nursing building will be beautiful., 419723=TIP do not over take any classes, you will fail, it's not like highschool, take your education seriously since you're paying for it, it's a different life in college, it's difficult and not financially stable at times if you don't have everything sorted out, I didn't which is making things difficult, I don't even know if I'm getting the education I want for upcoming semester of Spring 2014. Do not procrastinate in turning in your FAFSA, make sure you talk to a counselor, do not be shy, it's your future, your goals, and your career you're wanting here. I wish I WOULD'VE done all of those things. I WOULD'VE been on track and not slipping back., 21590=I started here in the fall of 2010 and currently still attending. Long Beach City college it's a really good school with the most helpful teachers. The staff are great as well and everyone is friendly. It has a really good learning environment and plenty of sources for you to succeed.}

textAfterTable: Sean-Michael from Artesia, CA 11/07/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 2 of 113 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Athletic students will like Long Beach City College, because it has a large array of sports to choose from, from swimming to football. Don't stop playing sports if you loved them in High School, or if you did not do so well back then. Now is your chance to redeem yourself. Tips for prospective students If you're just getting ready to become a part of Long Beach City College, or any college for that matter, I would suggest that you take your most challenging courses first. Doing this will help you speed through school by staying in your high school mode. Take summer school classes because they usually have less homework and are a lot faster than taking a full length class. Pace yourself like a runner. Push hard in the summer, stride in the Fall, and build up momentum in the Spring. Bang for the buck
